title: Black-eyed Bean Stew with Baby Squid

ingredients.content: 500 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces
100 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, leeks, celery), sliced (1 cm)
350 g black-eyed beans, dried, soaked for at least 4 hours
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
270 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, leek, celery), sliced (1 cm)
1000 g whole baby squid, cleaned, fresh or defrosted
ground black pepper, plus extra for squid
extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to drizzle

preparations.content: Place onions, garlic and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>, then sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add tomatoes and tomato purée and blend <b>7 sec/speed 6<b>.

Add 100 g mixed vegetables, sweet paprika, salt, pepper, drained soaked black-eyed beans, water and vegetable stock paste. Arrange remaining mixed vegetables and squid in Varoma dish and tray, season with salt and pepper, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and combine using spatula. Set Varoma in position and steam <b>30 min/Varoma//speed <b>. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm and check that beans are cooked through. If not, cook a further <b>5-10 min/Varoma//speed <b>.

Add lemon juice (if using) to beans and allow to rest in mixing bowl for 10 minutes. Transfer stew to a deep serving plate, sprinkle with chopped fresh coriander (if using) and serve hot with squid and vegetables.
